Name: Kathmandu Valley
Description: The capital region of Nepal, home to the capital city Kathmandu, and known for its rich history, ancient temples, and vibrant culture.

Name: Bagmati
Description: A province encompassing Kathmandu and surrounding areas, it includes cultural, religious, and natural landmarks.

Name: Lumbini
Description: The birthplace of Buddha, this region is famous for its spiritual significance and many Buddhist monasteries.

Name: Gandaki
Description: A central region of Nepal, home to the famous Annapurna mountain range and scenic trekking routes.

Name: Province No. 1
Description: A region in eastern Nepal, known for its diverse landscapes, including the eastern Himalayas and the Sagarmatha National Park.

Name: Province No. 2
Description: A region in southeastern Nepal, known for its agricultural land, ethnic diversity, and cultural heritage.

Name: Karnali
Description: A mountainous region in mid-western Nepal, known for its rivers, valleys, and trekking routes.

Name: Sudurpashchim
Description: The far western region of Nepal, characterized by diverse ethnic communities and beautiful natural landscapes.
